schema.name: Orange “Soy” Salmon

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the salmon tail under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Peel the oranges and segment them over a bowl to catch the juice. Squeeze the remaining membrane to extract all the juice.
In a small bowl, mix the coconut aminos with half of the orange juice.
Place the salmon tail in a baking dish and pour the coconut aminos and orange juice mixture over it, ensuring it's well-coated.
Bake in the preheated oven until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork, about 20-25 minutes.
Serve the salmon with the remaining orange segments and drizzle with the sauce from the baking dish.

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sodium meal with our Orange “Soy” Salmon. A perfect combination of juicy oranges and savory salmon, tailored for those who enjoy healthy yet flavorful recipes. This dish is a testament to how health-conscious choices do not have to compromise on taste, making it a must-try for anyone looking to enhance their culinary repertoire with healthier options.
